articles.title: Floral Tribute to Statues of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Floral Tribute to Statues of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- The participants in the 8th Pyongyang Autumn International Trade Fair laid a floral basket before the equestrian statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il at the Mansudae Art Studio on Sunday before paying tribute to them.

articles.title: Delegation of Eurasia-Pacific UNINET Visits Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Delegation of Eurasia-Pacific UNINET Visits Mangyongdae
 Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Eurasia-Pacific UNINET led by Vice-Chairman Wolf-Dieter Rausch visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung, on Sunday.  
					 The delegation is here to take part in the joint academic seminar of Kim Il Sung University and the Eurasia-Pacific UNINET.
					
					 Being briefed on the revolutionary life of Kim Il Sung and the family members of Mangyongdae at his old home, members of the delegation went round historic relics preserved with much care.
					
					 The head of the delegation said that he was deeply impressed by his every visit to Mangyongdae. The visit helped him know better about the revolutionary history of the President, he noted, adding the Korean people could create the history of development as they have held the President in high esteem.
					
					 The delegation also visited the Tower of the Juche Idea, Arch of Triumph, Mausoleum of King Tangun, etc.

articles.title: US Urged to Abandon Its War Plan
articles.content:
US Urged to Abandon Its War Plan
 Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- The U.S., seized by megalomania that it is the world's only "super power", is going reckless without any elementary calculation only falling into ruin.
					 Rodong Sinmun on Sunday says this in a bylined article.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 Anachronistic is the intention of the U.S. to ignite the second war to invade the DPRK in order to escape the crisis.
					
					 What the U.S. has forgotten is its bitter defeat in the past Korean War.
					
					 The Korean War in the 1950s clearly proved that there is no match in the world to the Korean people all out for the just cause.
					
					 The U.S. experienced the great might of the stout-hearted people for the first time in its history of aggression. It was more horrible than A-bomb.
					
					 The present U.S. ruling quarters and warlike forces are now oblivious of this. They are also forgetful of the reason why the preceding administrations dared not unleash a war for aggression on the DPRK though they eagerly wanted to start it.
					
					 If the U.S. provokes a new war against the DPRK, it will suffer the great defeat incomparable with the one in the past Korean War.
					
					 A new Korean war being attempted by the U.S. is a hopeless adventure.
					
					 The war will bring the U.S. nothing but only ruin.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak Regime's Construction of Naval Assailed
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak Regime's Construction of Naval Assailed
 Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- Minju Joson on Sunday in a bylined commentary brands the south Korean puppet regime's construction of a naval base on Jeju Island as an unpardonable treachery to escalate the tension on the Korean Peninsula and turn the island into the U.S. nuclear outpost.
					 It continues:
					
					 That the bellicose forces of south Korea are going ahead with the construction clearly indicates their black-hearted intention to realize their wild ambition of "unification under the liberal and democratic system" at any cost by escalating the military confrontation, an open challenge to the DPRK.
					
					 The regime seeks two things in pushing forward the construction.
					
					 One is to tighten the military nexus with the U.S. The other is to garner the votes of the military and the pro-U.S. conservative forces in the forthcoming "presidential election".
					
					 The Lee herd of traitors makes no scruple of committing such an act of treachery as offering people's cradle of life to the foreign forces as a nuclear outpost in order to do harm to the fellow countrymen.
					
					 It is also a very cause of the tension being screwed up on the peninsula and in the rest of Asia.
					
					 The Lee herd of traitors and the mob of the "Saenuri Party" will never be pardoned for their acts.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK will show no mercy to the group of traitors keen on bringing nuclear disaster to the Korean nation in collaboration with foreign forces.

articles.title: Japanese PM's Remarks Censured
articles.content:
Japanese PM's Remarks Censured
 Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- Some days ago, the Japanese prime minister talked about the "nuclear and missile issue" of the DPRK at the high-ranking officers' meeting of the "Self-Defense Forces" and told them to get full readiness.
					 His remarks are nothing but incoherent comment to convince the public that military threat Japan faces is attributable to the DPRK.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Sunday says this in a bylined commentary.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries sped up their moves to become a military giant and expand its territory overseas in full scale and this has reached the dangerous phase.
					
					 The Japanese military warmongers seek to additionally equip themselves with the ballistic missile tracking AN/TPY-2 radar which was developed by the United States for the early detection of the DPRK's launch of missiles. Clear is the intention of the Japanese reactionaries. They seek to secure the unlimited attack capabilities for aggression on the DPRK and other countries in Asia by improving their missile defence system with the help of the U.S., and become a "leader of Asia" by gaining military upper-hand.
					
					  The Japanese reactionaries introduced a new intelligence unit, a combination of the patrol and reconnaissance unit command of the U.S. Pacific Fleet in Yokohama City and its affiliated first patrol and reconnaissance flying corps command, into Misawa City. They are planning to build more high performance radar bases for tracking ballistic missiles in different places.
					
					  They cried out someone's threat and military beef-up but it is nonsense to draw curtain over their criminal intentions.
					
					  The Japanese prime minister's call on the SDF goes to prove that the Japanese militarists have entered the practical phase in their moves for overseas expansion.
					
					 Japan's moves for becoming a military giant and launching overseas expansion are an impolicy prompting its self-ruin.
					
					 The Japanese militarists had better come to their senses and behave with discretion.

articles.title: Foreign Forces Should Not Be Allowed to Interfere in Disputes
articles.content:
Foreign Forces Should Not Be Allowed to Interfere in Disputes
 Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- One can neither achieve prosperity in the new century nor defend the country's sovereignty as long as the U.S.-led imperialists' military intervention and aggression moves are allowed. This is a lesson drawn from the present complicated international situation. Rodong Sinmun says this in a bylined article Sunday.
					 The solution to disputes on the international arena at present is a pressing task which brooks no further delay, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 It is important to reject in time brigandish sophism and false propaganda peddled by the imperialists in shattering their military intervention and aggression moves.
					
					 The world progressive people aspiring after peace should refrain from remaining a passive onlooker to the spread of misinformation and false propaganda or joining them while thinking of only the interests of their countries and nations.
					
					 One should approach the imperialists' crafty moves for division and estrangement with vigilance. They are making a crafty use of various complicated issues including the border issue, the leftover of the colonial rule, driving a wedge and creating antagonism and conflict among countries in a bid to pit them against each other.
					
					 They are regarding arbitrary and strong-arm action as major means for realizing their foreign policy for aggression. They are acting at random, wantonly violating the recognized principles and norms of international relations.
					
					 Historical facts show that if one does not build up the strong driving force with one's own efforts, one cannot resolutely shatter the evermore intensified reactionary offensive of the imperialists but reduce to slave in the long run.
					
					 What is basic in handling the international disputes is for the parties concerned to settle them through peaceful dialogue and negotiations. Herein lies the key to settling the complicated international disputes.

articles.title: Repressive Step of S. Korean "Ministry of Unification"
articles.content:
Repressive Step of S. Korean "Ministry of Unification"
 Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- The south Korean "Ministry of Unification" on Sept. 19 took a fascist step of levying fine on the Council for the Solution of the Issue of the Volunteers' Corps, unreasonably charging it with conducting exchange with the north.
					 On the occasion of August 15, the anniversary of Korea's liberation, the council decided to jointly publish with the north a statement condemning Japan's past sexual slavery and opposing south Korea's military cooperation with Japan.
					
					 The "Ministry of Unification" forced the council to delete content dealing with military cooperation with Japan from the draft statement at that time, but the council refused.
					
					 So, the ministry blocked the council's exchange and then took such a repressive step.
					
					 In this regard the permanent representative of the council said it would strongly counter this, saying it is something not desirable that the ministry obstructs the south-north exchange though it is obliged to support it.

articles.title: S. Korean "Saenuri Party" Accused of Refusing to Apologize for Past Crimes
articles.content:
S. Korean "Saenuri Party" Accused of Refusing to Apologize for Past Crimes
 Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Democracy, People's Life, Peaceful Reunification and Sovereignty of south Korea on Sept. 18 released a commentary denouncing the "Saenuri Party" clan for refusing to apologize for its past crimes.
					 The anachronistic approach to the historical fact by the Election Measure Committee of the "Saenuri Party" has been increasingly ridiculed, the commentary said.
					
					 Shortly ago, the riff-raffs of the measure committee let loose a spate of invectives that "apology for the case of the People's Revolutionary Party should be made only to the victims", the commentary recalled, terming it a mockery of the bereaved families of the victims and a refusal to apologize for the fabrication of the case, in fact.
					
					 The above-said remarks are sparking off resentment of people from all walks of life in view of the fact that the "Saenuri Party" has consistently defended the May 16 military coup and the "yusin" dictatorial rule, it noted.
					
					 The group of traitors will be sternly judged by the people for its acts to bring this land back to the past period when the military fascist dictatorship was rampant, it stressed.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Revolutionary Activities Given Publicity in Laos, Peru
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Revolutionary Activities Given Publicity in Laos, Peru
 Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- The news of the revolutionary activities conducted by the dear respected Kim Jong Un were given publicity in Laos, Peru and by a regional organization on Sept. 13 and 18.
					 The Lao News Agency said Marshal Kim Jong Un, supreme leader of the Workers' Party of Korea and the Korean people, enjoyed the extravaganza "Arirang", Kim Il Sung Prize winner, with Pyongyang citizens.
					
					 It said "Arirang" is displaying its tremendous vitality as a proud national treasure of Juche Korea as it received the "grand medal of the sun" and the order of "peace" from different countries and the certificate of Guinness world records book in August 2007.
					
					 The extravaganza staged in vast three-dimensional space was a perfect combination of graceful and spectacular rhythms, dynamic gymnastics, refined artistic representation rich in national flavor, ever-changing background scenes, gorgeous stage decor, peculiar lighting, etc., it noted, adding it clearly showcased the inexhaustible strength and talents of the Korean people and the rapid development of Juche arts.
					
					 Kim Jong Un expressed great satisfaction over the fact that the extravaganza was successfully re-represented in reflection of the requirements of the developing era and aspiration of the people, extending thanks to the performers and creators of the performance, it said.
					
					 The Peruvian-Korean Institute of Culture and Friendship posted similar news on its Internet homepage.
					
					 The International Alliance of Societies for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Policy in East European and Central Asian Regions posted on its Internet homepage the photo-accompanied news that Kim Jong Un visited families of working people who moved to new flats in Changjon Street.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Life Praised by Russian Paper
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Life Praised by Russian Paper
 Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- The 6th issue of the Russian newspaper Intseresnaya Gazeta carried an article titled "Life for People" together with a photo of President Kim Il Sung among schoolchildren. 
					 It said:
					
					 Kim Il Sung, the great son of the Korean people, believed in the people as in Heaven all his life. 
					
					 He fathered the Juche idea that the popular masses are the masters of the revolution and construction and they are capable of promoting the revolution and construction, and successfully led the arduous Korean revolution for a long time. 
					
					 During the 15-year-long anti-Japanese armed struggle he untied people, achieved the victory relying on their strength and finally liberated Korea. 
					
					 People's power was established first in the history of Korea in its liberated land and workers, peasants and intellectuals were elected representatives of the people and they drew up the state policy. 
					
					 All the democratic reforms including agrarian reform and nationalization of major industries reflected the noble intention of Kim Il Sung for putting forward the people as master of the country and society. 
					
					 He believed in the strength of the people and regarded them as teacher.
					
					 He, the son of the people, left great impressions in their hearts, the newspaper said, introducing anecdotes about his love for the people in detail.

articles.title: Exploits of Kim Jong Suk Praised in Peru
articles.content:
Exploits of Kim Jong Suk Praised in Peru
 Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- The Peruvian Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism published a special issue of its bulletin on Sept. 17 to mark the 63rd anniversary of the death of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk. 
					 It carried a fine art piece portraying Kim Jong Suk, woman commander of Mt. Paektu. 
					
					 It said as follows:
					
					 Kim Jong Suk led in her early years the work of the anti-Japanese Children's Corps and became a member of the Young Communist League and grew to be a revolutionary. 
					
					 She joined the Korean People's Revolutionary Army and waged indomitable struggle in every battlefield during the anti-Japanese war. 
					
					 She devotedly protected President Kim Il Sung as his faithful revolutionary soldier. 
					
					 She fully carried out his idea and line without fail and mercilessly shattered all the reactionary elements opposed to them. 
					
					 She created an example of loyalty to the leader. 
					
					 The revolutionary exploits of Kim Jong Suk, mother of revolution and model of anti-imperialist struggle and the movement for emancipation of women, will remain long in the hearts of the world people.

articles.title: Normalization of DPRK-Japan Relations Demanded in Japan
articles.content:
Normalization of DPRK-Japan Relations Demanded in Japan
 Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- A meeting took place in Tokyo on Sept. 13 in demand of the normalization of the DPRK-Japan relations on the occasion of the 10th anniversary of the DPRK-Japan Pyongyang Declaration. 
					 Participating in the meeting were Japanese political and social personages including representatives of the organizations for friendship and solidarity with the Korean people and social organizations from across Japan. Nam Sung U, vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan, was present there on invitation. 
					
					 Sumiko Shimizu, representative of the Japanese Women's Society for Solidarity with the Korean Women, and other personages made speeches. 
					
					 A message from the Korean Society for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries was read out at the meeting. 
					
					 A letter of request to the Japanese prime minister was adopted there. 
					
					 It said that though a decade has passed since the Japan-DPRK Pyongyang Declaration was made public, the Japanese government has persistently pursued one-sided policy imposing sanctions on the DPRK. 
					
					 The government excluded Korean schools in Japan from tuition-waiver program and continued to foster antipathy against Koreans in Japan among Japanese people, it said, and went on:
					
					 Now is the time to make a decision for opening a new history in the spirit of the Japan-DPRK Pyongyang Declaration. The Japanese government should reaffirm the spirit of the declaration and express the stand for normalization of the Japan-DPRK relations and actively come out for the inter-governmental talks. 
					
					 The government should immediately lift the sanctions against the DPRK and take concrete measures for the A-bomb victims and those who fell victim to the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army and forced drafting, and apply the tuition-waiver program to the Korean schools without delay.
